intro: Scabiosa africana, commonly known as the African ladies' mantle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, velvety, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and purple, bloom in spring and summer. Scabiosa africana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
